Above the pebbly layer is the main fossiliferous bed. It is about 30 cm thick and is gravelly. Above it is a layer of strongly cemented concretions. "191150","occ","","","19194","Cupidinimus n. sp. boronensis","species","45387","","Cupidinimus boronensis","","species","45387","Early Hemingfordian","","20.43","15.97","Whistler","1984","3625","Chordata","Mammalia","Rodentia","Heteromyidae","Cupidinimus","","","56","specimens","-117.686584","35.052204","","Boron","","UCR RV-6421; United States Borax and Chemical Corporation mine","US","California","San Bernardino","based on political unit","6","small collection","4.8 km NW of Boron","gp_mid","-111.30","39.82","101","US","","Kramer Beds","","Arkose","","","","","","","","","","","","""Observations made in the pit in 1964 and from the fossil-bearing matrix indicate the fossils were restricted to one or more beds of light tan micaceous clay- stones which locally contain pumice lapilli fragments. These beds were part ofa sequence offluviatile siltstones and sand- stones locally cut by channels of coarser arkosic sandstones and pebble conglomerates. About 3 m above the fossil-pro- ducing beds were several discontinuous lenses of grayish- pink bentonitic tuff and yellowish-white, medium-grained sandy tuff.""","claystone","micaceous,volcaniclastic,brown","","","Y","sandstone","","","silty","","fluvial indet.","","","macrofossils,mesofossils","","","","","","","","body","","","","","","","","","","","","","general faunal/floral","","","","115 specimens","","","March 1964","""Fossils of the Boron Local Fauna were not observed at the original site of deposition by the author. They were first noticed by several mine employees operating heavy equip- ment removing overburden from the open pit mine. The mine foreman informed the geology staff who had the remaining fossil-bearing matrix dumped in a separate location from the general mine dump so that the fossils could be recovered. It is not certain how much of the fossil-bearing pocket was lost before this action was taken, but 4-5 earth-mover loads (12-15 cubic meters) were subsequently recovered before the pocket stopped producing readily visible fossil bone.""","146 m over basalt dated at 18.3 +/- 0.6, 19.7 +/- 0.6, 20.3 +/- 0.7 Ma; last date is definitely KA<br>NISP 115","terrestrial","","actively mobile","ground dwelling","","granivore, browser","viviparous","","","phosphatic","","","","Cupidinimus","Kramer Beds","","Arkose","Burdigalian","Burdigalian","Burdigalian","Burdigalian","Burdigalian","D. It is not certain how much of the fossil-bearing pocket was lost before this action was taken, but 4-5 earth-mover loads (12-15 cubic meters) were subsequently recovered before the pocket stopped producing readily visible fossil bone.""","146 m over basalt dated at 18.3 +/- 0.6, 19.7 +/- 0.6, 20.3 +/- 0.7 Ma; last date is definitely KA<br>NISP 115","terrestrial","","actively mobile","","","grazer","viviparous","","","phosphatic","","","","Aletomeryx","Kramer Beds","","Arkose","Burdigalian","Burdigalian","Burdigalian","Burdigalian","Burdigalian","D.
